intro: Nemacladus glandulifer var. orientalis, commonly known as the oriental glandular nemacladus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenia plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy foliage, which give it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and botanical research.
